title.narrative: Promote innovation in local agro-ecological production systems in northern Honduras

description.narrative: Current rural policies are aimed at strengthening mono-cropping and agribusiness, not small farmers. In Honduras, 8 out of 10 families have no land or less than five hectares of land to work. Poverty exceeds 70% in households in rural areas and 40% of rural households live in extreme poverty. The last two years in Honduras has seen a food crisis that was considered unprecedented in the history of the country. It affected 64 municipalities in the country and more than 76 000 small producers. The project aims to improve the livelihoods of 90 rural families in northern Honduras. The project will use a participatory strategy to engage 30 families in implementing changes in the management of their agricultural crops, soil, food production and marketing. The project will promote an agro-ecological production system that is environmentally friendly and improves the resilience of the social -natural systems to the effects of climate change. ERIC-RP will show that agro-ecological systems strengthen food sovereignty and security, and nutrition. Project sustainability rests on the learning and management abilities of rural families for increasing sustainable production and marketing of products, generating more income for rural families and promoting equity. The main goal of the project is to increase income and produce enough food during the year to improve nutrition. As part of the accompaniment of the groups, the goal is to help farmers improve their decision making so their investments improve sustainability and social responsibility.
